intro: Dalea caeciliae, commonly known as the Caecilia's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Dalea caeciliae is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
